sense.name: contract, as a muscle
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate|organization]] FLEX NP2[patient[body_part]] (PP[cause]) (PP[recipient]) NP1[patient[body_part]] FLEX (PP[cause]) (PP[recipient])
sense.examples: You could see his hands flexing, already pulling the trigger. She caught a glimpse of Stresa's quilled body flexing. Iran flexes its military muscles. Ivory Latta flexed her muscles at LeBron James. He flexed his muscles at the thought of finally choosing.

sense.name: cause something flexible to bend
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent|cause] FLEX NP1[patient] NP1[patient] FLEX (PP[cause])
sense.examples: The bridge flexed under Farinelli's weight. The RV rippled and flexed. The bristly tentacle around Conan's waist flexed. I actually gently flexed the rod against the floor. We flex the rod when we flycast. The sling-holder's weight flexed the beam.

sense.name: cause an object to assume a bent or crooked form
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] FLEX NP2[material] PP[product]
sense.examples: He flexed the rod into a right angle.
